author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
People shift a man injured in firing to a hospital in Srinagar on Sunday. — Photo: AFP

Two civilians, including a woman, were killed and over a dozen people injured in security forces firing near an encounter site in south Kashmir’s Pulwama district on Sunday, sparking violent protests. Earlier, a local militant was also killed in the encounter.

Protests were reported in Pulwama district when the news about the killing of a local Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) militant, identified as Adil Ahmad, spread in the area.

The Army’s 50 Rashtriya Rifles, the CRPF and the police had sealed Lelhaar area of Pulwama after reports about the presence of three militants in the area.

However, the protests engulfed parts of the area when the operation was on against the militants.

Security forces allegedly also fired upon civilians in a residential area near Gousia School, Khar Mohallah, of Kakapora. A student, a resident of Lilhaar, received a firearm injury and died.

The killing of two civilians, the second such incident after the January 20 incident in which a civilian dead near the encounter site, triggered unrest in south Kashmir.

However, the police said: “We started evacuating civilians trapped in the cordon. A large number of people were evacuated but a lady named Shaista, while taking cover, was hit by a bullet. Some miscreants and stone-pelters received bullet injuries in the crossfire,” said a Srinagar-based spokesman.

Shutdown today

In protest, all separatists groups have called a shutdown on Monday. The Congress and the National Conference also condemned the killings.
title: 2 civilians killed in Kashmir firing
